title: Distribution & Installability
description: Installable extension without repo checkout. Deterministic launcher/quark discovery (Quarks install required for users; vendored quark for dev), global tasks.json guidance, clean metadata, user-facing INSTALL + troubleshooting, release smoke.
design:
## Plan

### Extension Packaging
- Keep extension self-contained: grammar wasm, queries, snippets, runnables.
- Tasks live in user global `~/.config/zed/tasks.json`; no per-project `.zed`.

### Launcher Distribution
- Primary channel: cargo install; secondary: GitHub release binaries.
- Discovery: settings.path > PATH > dev fallback (repo-only). Add --mode probe health check + slash-command help.

### LanguageServer.quark Strategy
- Require Quarks.install("LanguageServer") for distribution; keep vendored quark for dev only.

### Tasks/Runnables UX
- Runnables map to tasks in user global config; expose eval/boot/stop keypaths; single Post Window task tied to SC_TMP_DIR/TMPDIR.

### Documentation
- INSTALL.md: prerequisites (SC app, Quarks install), global tasks.json snippet, launcher install, settings snippet, troubleshoot.
- DEV.md: hacking on repo, vendored quark, dev launcher fallback.

### Release/Verification
- Smoke: launcher probe, LSP init, HTTP eval 202, tasks work with global config, extension bundle clean of dev artifacts.

## Open Decisions
1. Cargo install UX vs release binaries: finalize install string + platform coverage.
2. Versioning/publish cadence for extension + launcher and how to surface in docs.
notes:
## Principles
- Keep extension self-contained (grammar wasm, queries, snippets/keymaps, runnables) with no per-project .zed dependence.
- Tasks are user-global (tasks.json) and documented; no hidden per-project requirements.
- Treat launcher + quark as external deps discoverable via PATH or settings; preserve dev ergonomics without leaking dev defaults.
- Prefer deterministic discovery and actionable logging over heuristics.

title: Investigate and fix slow cargo test performance
Address LSP provider performance and robustness issues
description:
Code review of commits 8994fa3-5bf2834 identified several issues:

HIGH PRIORITY:
- Performance: Synchronous file I/O in HoverProvider.sc:56 and FindReferencesProvider.prClassDocRange:98 blocks on disk. Add caching layer for class documentation.
- Race condition: TextDocumentProvider didChange handler forces isOpen=true without proper initialization (commit 3525618). Need proper document initialization or change queueing.

MEDIUM PRIORITY:
- Fragile comment extraction: HoverProvider and FindReferencesProvider use simple find() to extract class docs, can match wrong comments. Should parse from class definition location.
- Code duplication: Rehydration pattern duplicated across HoverProvider, FindReferencesProvider, DocumentSymbolProvider. Extract to LSPDocument.ensureHydrated() helper.

Recommendations:
1. Add LSPDatabase.getClassDocumentation() with classDocCache
2. Extract rehydration to LSPDocument.ensureHydrated(uri)
3. Improve comment extraction to search from class charPos
4. Add tests for race conditions and edge cases

Files: HoverProvider.sc, FindReferencesProvider.sc, DocumentSymbolProvider.sc, TextDocumentProvider.sc, LSPDatabase.sc

title: Quark identity: rename and publish forked LanguageServer
description:
We maintain a modified fork of LanguageServer.quark with Zed-specific changes. Users cannot use the upstream quark. This creates confusion and installation friction.

## Problem
- Our quark is in server/quark/LanguageServer.quark but is NOT the upstream LanguageServer
- Users who Quarks.install('LanguageServer') get the wrong one
- README doesn't clarify this
- Launcher has workarounds (--include-path, --exclude-path) to prefer vendored copy

## Proposed Solution
1. **Rename quark** to distinguish from upstream (e.g., ZedLanguageServer, zed-supercollider-lsp)
2. **Publish to Quarks registry** under new name so users can Quarks.install it
3. **Update launcher** to reference new quark name in logs/errors
4. **Update README** with clear install instructions
5. **Update AGENTS.md** anti-patterns section

## Scope
- server/quark/LanguageServer.quark/ (rename directory + internal references)
- server/launcher/src/main.rs (quark detection, logging)
- README.md, INSTALL.md
- Quarks registry submission

## Open Questions
- What name? ZedLanguageServer vs zed-supercollider-lsp vs other
- Should upstream LanguageServer be listed as a conflict/alternative?
- Do we need to coordinate with upstream maintainer?

title: LSP Debugging and Status
description: Debugging LSP in Zed SuperCollider extension. Hover, go-to-definition, and references now working.
notes:
## Final Status
- Hover: working (returns symbol + first block comment from class file)
- Go-to-definition: working
- References: working for user classes (SinOscFB); built-ins may open class docs but sometimes errors if the installed quark is stale
- Outline: empty because Zed is not sending textDocument/documentSymbol

## Gotchas
- Installed quark may be stale. If references keep failing or show "Non Boolean in test", ensure the installed LanguageServer copy matches the repo (server/quark/LanguageServer.quark/Providers/FindReferencesProvider.sc). User prefers we do NOT overwrite their installed quark ever.
- Zed outline won't work until the client sends textDocument/documentSymbol; nothing on server side yet.
- Keep config.toml minimal (see anti-patterns in .ai/context.md).

## Logs
See /tmp/sclang_post.log for REFS DEBUG lines; errors "Non Boolean in test" indicate the references provider fallback logic.

title: Execution Plan – Stability & Delivery
description: Ship stable extension with accurate capabilities and reliable eval/control before distribution. Phase 1 blockers: capability hygiene, logging defaults, tasks/PIDs decision, dev launcher selection, packaging/meta hygiene, references crash fix. Phase 2 polish: init/shutdown, eval transport hardening, buffered flush, response normalization, structured logging, async eval docs. Later: perf/maint (LRU, UDP constants, startup timing).
notes:
## Validation Checklist
- Initialize response aligns with capabilities; no serverStatus; dev binary selection doesn't throw ENOENT
- Eval/control tasks return real HTTP status; kill task (if kept) targets only tracked PIDs
- scripts/validate-config.sh + launcher tests pass in CI stub
- Shutdown closes stdin, sends LSP shutdown/exit, and leaves no orphaned sclang/sc_launcher
- README/setup match logging defaults and eval semantics

## Guardrails
- config.toml stays minimal (no opt_into_language_servers/scope_opt_in_language_servers)
- SC dict funcs never use ^; init classvars in *initClass; handle nil dict keys
- Do not overwrite user-installed quark without consent; test vendored copy first
- HTTP eval is fire-and-forget; results land in Post Window/logs, not inline

## Scope
Launcher (server/launcher/src/main.rs), extension (src/lib.rs), quark (server/quark/LanguageServer.quark), language config/tasks (languages/SuperCollider, .zed/tasks.json, scripts), docs/CI guardrails.

title: References crash fix
description:
Fix 'Non Boolean in test' crash in FindReferencesProvider.sc. Coerce includeDeclaration parameter to boolean.

## Root Cause (identified 2026-01-07)
- Line 61: var includeDecl = params["context"] !? _["includeDeclaration"] !? _.asBoolean ?? { false };
- Line 74: if (defs.size == 0 and: { includeDecl }) - crashes when includeDecl is nil

## Fix
Change line 61 to: var includeDecl = (params["context"] !? _["includeDeclaration"] ?? { false }).asBoolean;

## Testing
Requires user to test in Zed - trigger 'find references' on SinOsc or other built-in class
